label: 藤原長兼
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Fujiwara no Nagakane (J.) 藤原長兼, also called 頼房 Yorifusa, with the religious name of 覚阿 Kaku'a. This aristocrat rose to positions such as head of chamberlains as well as major controller of the right then the left before becoming deputy middle counsellor in 1211. A close confidante of the leaders of the Kujō house of the northern Fujiwaras, Nagakane also wrote a diary, usually known as Sanchōki.
